types.description: Analog input reader. Default range is 0 - 4095 (12 bits) and can be changed by 'mask' options to support different chip manufacturers.
types.name: aio/reader

members.description: Label of the desired pin on the board. If raw is set to true, this should be "<device> <pin>" pair, e.g. "0 3".
members.name: pin

members.description: Change 'pin' meaning to be the system parameters needed to address the desired pin. Use it if you know what you are doing.
members.name: raw

members.description: Number of valid bits. This number is used to filter data received from hardware (which is manufacturer dependent), therefore should not be used as a way to change the output range because the mask is applied to the least significant bits.
members.name: mask

members.description: Polling time in milliseconds. This option will take no effect if hardware interruptions for GPIO is supported by the underlying system. Use it if you know that you don't have those interruptions available.
members.name: poll_timeout
